note: Synthetic example for automation tooling; not a full authoritative catalog.

3.1.1.name: Limit system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other systems).

3.1.2.name: Limit system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

3.1.3.name: Control the flow of CUI in accordance with approved authorizations.

3.1.5.name: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

3.3.1.name: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable the monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful, unauthorized, or inappropriate system activity.

3.4.1.name: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems.

3.5.1.name: Identify system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices.

3.5.3.name: Use multi-factor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.

3.13.8.name: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.

3.13.11.name: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.
